Evolve Class List

Here are the classes, structs, unions and interfaces with brief descriptions:
evolve::CommandHandler
CommandsSingleton class that contains command constants (and maybe one or two others *duck*), auto-generated by commandGenerator.py from Commands.xml Eventually, a hierarchy of contants may be created (but the work is not really justifiable at this point The command contants are the commands used for the various clients & servers to communicate
evolve::CommonAspectVarious aspects of evolve objects that cut across all objects
Ogre::GDKCodec
evolve::InterpreterProvides an interface to an object that can interpret lSystems The interpretation is a string (which will most likely need further interpretation) The interpretation of a particular interpreter can be controlled by a set of attributes
InterpreterCommandHandlerTODO: insert class comments
evolve::LoggerA simple class that provides a logging facility for debug and notification messages
evolve::LSystemLSystem class reads in a file containing a string an information on how to evolve that string, namely probablities of change, and values and positions to chance
evolve::LSystemGenericLSystemGeneric class reads in a file containing a string an information on how to evolve that string, namely probablities of change, and values and positions to chance
evolve::LSystemGenericInterpreter
evolve::LSystemIncrementalInterpreterClass designed to incrementally interpret an lsystem, and allow for it to be updated This is so we can update it to respond to environmental changes, like physics
evolve::LSystemWorldObject
evolve::MutexA class to wrap a simple mutex object This class exists mainly to ease portability issues in the future IMPORTANT: this class is to be maintained in lockstep with whatever threading library we happend to use
MutexInClass

SDLFrame
evolve::ServerClass that factors out all the server listening & spawning thread code Essentially just starts up a server socket, listens, parses a command, and dispatches it to whatever handler library it loaded for this instance
evolve::SocketMethodsA class that wraps around socket methods Provides a message boundary facility
Unless otherwised noted, a method that returns a bool returns true on success, false on failure This is a class (instead of the more apt abstraction, the namespace) because I want to do stuff like inherit from the CommonAspect Also, I think I like the idea of a delimiter on a per object basis? This is still an open issue in my head though
evolve::StandardCameraWrapper around ogre camera which methods to make it behave in a "standard" fashion based on the given user input
